chapter.para: &productname; is typically configured in two stages, at first during the installation process and after installation you can configure your cluster by using cloud-init. The first stage configuration of &productname; comes as much preconfigured as possible. The second stage is typically used for large scales clusters, if you have just several machine, cloud-init is not necessary.
Each configuration stage is described in the following sections.

sect1.title: Configuration
sect1.para: The defaults for the first stage configuration are the following:
cloud-init is used after the installation is complete. You then define a set of configuration files that will be applied during the boot phase.
The cloud-init configuration can be loaded from different sources:

listitem.para: LocalDisk – cloud-init reads configuration from a local directory: /cloud-init-config
NoCloud – cloud-init reads configuration from a local directory or from a remote location.

sect1.para: cloud-init uses the following required configuration files: meta-data, user-data, and an optional file: vendor-data. Each file is described in the following sections.
